DataElement.preferredName: Breast Radiation Therapy Field Beam Arrangement Technique Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The technique used in the beam arrangement of the field for radiotherapy to the breast.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Breast Radiation Therapy Radiation Field Beam Arrangement Technique
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest._Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._The area of the body exposed to radiation during radiation therapy._A group of nearly parallel rays of electromagnetic radiation or a stream of particles._The spatial property of the way in which something is placed._A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.:use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.

Concepts.definition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Property.preferredDefinition: The area of the body exposed to radiation during radiation therapy.:A group of nearly parallel rays of electromagnetic radiation or a stream of particles.:The spatial property of the way in which something is placed.:A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

Concepts.definition: The area of the body exposed to radiation during radiation therapy.
A group of nearly parallel rays of electromagnetic radiation or a stream of particles.
The spatial property of the way in which something is placed.
A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Denoting the front surface of the body; often used to indicate the position of one structure relative to another.: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.: Denoting the back surface of the body; at or near the hind end in quadrupeds or toward the spine in primates.

PermissibleValues.value: Tangents and direct mixed photon and electron field for IMN
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Internal Mammary Lymph Node Tangential Fields And Direct Mixed Photon and Electron Field

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Internal Mammary Lymph Node Tangential Fields And Direct Mixed Photon and Electron Field
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any of the lymph nodes of the breast located under the ribcage, near the sternum.: A two-dimensional (2D) array of opposing, oblique beams of external radiation. This approach is most often used in the adjuvant radiotherapy of breast malignancies.: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.: A radiation therapy technique where external photon and electron beams are used to deliver treatment of superficial and deep-seated malignancies, respectively, while sparing underlying organs at risk.

Concepts.definition: Any of the lymph nodes of the breast located under the ribcage, near the sternum.
A two-dimensional (2D) array of opposing, oblique beams of external radiation. This approach is most often used in the adjuvant radiotherapy of breast malignancies.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.

Concepts.longName: Direct Mixed Photon and Electron Field
Concepts.definition: A radiation therapy technique where external photon and electron beams are used to deliver treatment of superficial and deep-seated malignancies, respectively, while sparing underlying organs at risk.

PermissibleValues.value: Tangents and direct electron only field for IMN
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Internal Mammary Lymph Node Tangential Fields And Direct Electron Field

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Internal Mammary Lymph Node Tangential Fields And Direct Electron Field
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any of the lymph nodes of the breast located under the ribcage, near the sternum.: A two-dimensional (2D) array of opposing, oblique beams of external radiation. This approach is most often used in the adjuvant radiotherapy of breast malignancies.: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.: A radiation therapy technique where external electron beams are used to deliver treatment to superficial malignancies while sparing underlying organs at risk.

Concepts.definition: Any of the lymph nodes of the breast located under the ribcage, near the sternum.
A two-dimensional (2D) array of opposing, oblique beams of external radiation. This approach is most often used in the adjuvant radiotherapy of breast malignancies.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
A radiation therapy technique where external electron beams are used to deliver treatment to superficial malignancies while sparing underlying organs at risk.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A radiation therapy technique where treatment is emitted along the central axis of an external radiation beam.

Concepts.definition: A radiation therapy technique where treatment is emitted along the central axis of an external radiation beam.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A two-dimensional (2D) array of opposing, oblique beams of external radiation. This approach is most often used in the adjuvant radiotherapy of breast malignancies.

Concepts.definition: A two-dimensional (2D) array of opposing, oblique beams of external radiation. This approach is most often used in the adjuvant radiotherapy of breast malignancies.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A radiation therapy technique used to treat breast malignancies where the treatment fields are wide superiorly to include the internal mammary nodes, but narrow inferiorly to reduce radiation exposure to the heart and lung.

Concepts.definition: A radiation therapy technique used to treat breast malignancies where the treatment fields are wide superiorly to include the internal mammary nodes, but narrow inferiorly to reduce radiation exposure to the heart and lung.
